definition: to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread

sentences.english: After the valley of the old lady installed dizzy returned to the house, by the valley.
sentences.chinese: 而谷老夫人裝暈之後回到屋裏，被穀風拆穿。

sentences.english: Do not lie, because there was debunked the day.
sentences.chinese: 不說謊話，因爲總有被拆穿的一天。

sentences.english: The TV news story blew his carefully fabricated cover.
sentences.chinese: 電視新聞拆穿了他精心編織的騙局。

sentences.english: Back to the cellar, Mr Zhang Yang Qin debunk the false face to face.
sentences.chinese: 回到地窖，楊琴當面拆穿了假的張志強。

sentences.english: Life has been so difficult some things do not expose.
sentences.chinese: 人生已經如此地艱難有些事情就不要拆穿。

sentences.english: Did not say lies, because there have been debunked one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要說謊，因爲總有被拆穿的一天。

definition: to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
